message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with the task of extracting justifications or rationales for neural predictions, which is a common problem in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The paper proposes a novel approach that combines a generator and an encoder to extract short and coherent text fragments as rationales. This approach is evaluated on multi-aspect sentiment analysis and question retrieval tasks, which are both relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper also involves information retrieval (IR) and computer vision (CV) tasks, which suggest that cs.IR and cs.CV are also possible sub-categories.
